anime.description: http://anidb.net/ch94945 [Shigeno Daigo] is an elementary student whose father, http://anidb.net/ch2067 [Gorou], is a professional baseball player. Inspired by his father, who was once a Major League player, Daigo started playing baseball with the Mifune Dolphins, a youth team. However, he was unable to live up to the expectations of being the son of a professional, and quit baseball after less than a year. Then, in the spring of his sixth-grade year, Daigo`s school welcomes a transfer student, http://anidb.net/ch94946 [Satou Hikaru], whose father is http://anidb.net/ch2074 [Satou Toshiya], a former Major League player and Gorou`s close friend. The fate of these two young men begins to move forward! Source: crunchyroll

tag.name: baseball
tag.description: Baseball is like a complicated version of Rounders. It involves hitting a ball with a stick, then running around several bases placed in the form of a diamond on a field. Big in the US, and also in Japan.

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: Weekly Shounen Sunday
tag.description: Weekly Shounen Sunday is a weekly shounen manga magazine published in Japan by Shogakukan since 1959. Contrary to its title, Weekly Shounen Sunday issues are released on Wednesdays. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Shigeno Gorou
character.description: The story`s main character, Goro Honda is a young talented baseball player. His love of the game stems from his father who played for the Yokohama Marine Stars. Wanting nothing more than to follow in his father`s footsteps, he strives to become a professional ball player. Thriving on the challenge of the mound, he puts everything into the competition. He makes friends easily, as people are drawn to his personality and his excitement of the game. After Momoko and Hideki married his name was changed to Goro Shigeno. He initially pitched right handed, but blew out his shoulder in senior little league. In junior high school and high school, he pitches left, but continues to bat right. While he never made it to Koshien, his excellent match against the Kaido High School earned him the attention of many professional baseball team`s scouts. However, he went to America and joined a Triple A team, the Memphis Bats. During the Baseball World Cup, he replaced the injured pitcher Noro, and played as an excellent closer. He used to only use the pitch gyroballs ("rising fastball"), though beginning with the Baseball World Cup, he has successfully added gyrofork ("forkball") to his repertoire.

character.name: Fujii
character.description: He is the first to agree on entering in the baseball club, wich Goro created in Seishuu, after being beaten in a one on one toss and hit game. He always makes mistakes during the games and he is always fired up when it`s his time to hit, but always misses.

episode.title: MAJOR2 オリジナルアニメーションCM
Major 2nd Commercial Movie
野球を好きな才能
The Talent of Loving Baseball
Yakyuu o Suki na Sainou
episode.summary: After seeing Hikaru`s excellent affinity for baseball during the practice match, Daigo is depressed that they so far apart. Hikaru encourages Daigo and appeals to his love for baseball, and invites him to the Dolphins` practice. On the weekend, Hikaru and Daigo get together in the morning at the river bank to play catch. From afar, the Dolphins` star player Urabe and his catcher Andy are watching... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ふたりのジュニア
The Two Juniors
Futari no Junior
episode.summary: Hikaru, the son of a big Major League batter Satou Toshiya, just got back from the homeland of baseball is already being put in as the outfielder during the practice match. Daigo, Fujii, and Tashiro all watch Hikaru`s first play with baited breath, but he flubs a completely basic fly and then follows up with a huge mis-throw. In reality, Hikaru is a complete baseball noob. But Hikaru just calmly enjoys his very first real baseball experience. On the other hand, Daigo is in awe of Hikaru`s physical and athletic prowess. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 二世でなければ
If I Wasn`t the Second
Nisei Denakereba
episode.summary: Satou Hikaru, the transfer student from the United States, is actually the son of Satou Takuya, the eternal friend and Major League teammate of Daigo`s father, Goro! Right away, Hikaru asks Daigo about advice for joining a local baseball team, but being Daigo, being completely off-put by baseball, gives Hikaru a rude answer. That evening, Daigo`s mother, Kaoru, receives a request for help from the Dolphins` manager, Fujii: "We don`t have enough players for the practice match this weekend, can we borrow Daigo?" Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 大吾の夢
Daigo`s Dream
Daigo no Yume
episode.summary: Shigeno Daigo is a grade schooler who`s father is a professional baseball player. Being enamored with his father Goro, who once even played in the Major League, Daigo joins the "Mifune Dolphins" baseball team. However, with the pressure of measuring up to his father, he can`t improve enough and quits after less than a year and turns to an uninspired lifestyle. Then, in the spring of 6th grade, a transfer student from the United States arrives. The new baseball anime you`ve heard so much about is finally ready to play ball! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アニメ メジャーセカンド まもなくプレーボール!
Episode S1
Anime Major Second Mamonaku Play Ball!
寿也の個人レッスン
Toshiya`s Personal Training
Toshiya no Kojin Lesson
episode.summary: My name is Sakura Mutsuko. I`m in class 6-2 at Mifune Grade School, so I`m classmates with Shigeno Daigo-kun. As my brother played for the local Dolphins team, I`ve loved baseball since I was a small! Seeing Shigeno-kun and Hikaru-kun practice, the urge to play baseball became overwhelming. With the middle school entrance exams coming up, my father was not too happy, but I managed to get approval and am now a member of the Dolphins! Now I just need someone to properly teach me baseball... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: いつか必ず
Some Day, for Sure
Itsuka Kanarazu
episode.summary: When Daigo plays catch with Hikaru, he once again gets a feeling that they could form a battery. However, at practice the next weekend, he`s shocked to find out that Hikaru has suddenly moved to his mother`s hometown in Gunma. Disappointed in Hikaru for not even saying a word before leaving the Dolphins and transferring schools, Daigo lashes out at Mutsuko when she tries to talk to him. Daigo refuses Toshiya`s special catcher training and holes up in his room. There, he gets a visitor.... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: キャッチボール
Catch
Catch Ball
episode.summary: With his mom suddenly being out of commission, Daigo has no choice but to go practice catching fast balls at the batting center. While there, the ex Major-Leaguer Satou Toshiya`s appearance stuns Daigo! Not only was he the excellent player who formed a battery with his father, but he also happens to be Hikaru`s father. Apparently Daigo`s father Gorou asked Toshiya to check up on him. And right away, Toshiya begins coaching Daigo at the batting center. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 特訓開始!
Commence Special Training!
Tokkun Kaishi!
episode.summary: Hikaru says he wants to be a pitcher because "it looks fun". Despite his terrible grip and form, his brutally fast balls are something to be reckoned with! After appointing Daigo his training partner, Hikaru casually suggests that the two of them form a battery. Daigo refuses the idea as impossible, based on his arm being weak. However, his sister Izumi points out that his personality and knowledge of baseball would actually make him a good catcher. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: バッテリーデビュー!
Battery Debut!
Battery Debut!
episode.summary: In their first match of the summer tournament, the Mifune Dolphins lost all of the four point lead they had due to Daigo`s grave mistake. Daigo is completely demoralized and depressed about that mistake, when an unexpected voice makes him look up at the fence. Unbelievably, Hikaru had come there all the way from Gunma! Slightly awkward, as he left the team behind back then, Hikaru was there without a uniform just to cheer the team on. But what`s that in Hikaru`s bag?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: やっちまった!
Now I`ve Done It!
Yacchimatta!
episode.summary: In the first match of the summer tournament against the Tanikawa Eagles, the Mifune Dolphins keep a 4 point lead all the way to the final innings. Urabe and catcher Andy are doing the brunt of the work, fueled by their desire to win their way up the tournament in order to get revenge on the Touto Boys, the team they once belonged to. The outfielders are also giving everything to protect their lead, but in the last inning, Urabe seems to have finally run out of stamina... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 夏の大会スタート!
The Summer Tournament Begins!
Natsu no Taikai Start!
episode.summary: The first match of the summer tournament is finally here! For Daigo and the other 6th graders, it`s the last tournament for them with the Mifune Dolphins. The Dolphins, who`ve been being beaten out in the first match the past years, are about to face the Tanikawa Eagles. Coach Tashiro, acknowledging his growth, puts in Daigo on the right field and 2nd batter. However, the star player Urabe and Nagai, now bumped down to 8th batter for Daigo, are not thrilled that someone riding on his father`s coattails is on the starting line up, and glare at Daigo. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 光の思い
Hikaru`s Feelings
Hikaru no Omoi
episode.summary: The Mifune Dolphins improve their teamwork a bit during a practice match before the summer tournament, which improves their confidence. On the other hand, having had to transfer to his mother`s hometown in Gunma, Hikaru is separated from his Dolphins teammates and was having unhappy days. In front of his grandfather and mother he bravely put up a cheerful front, but even when he is invited to join the school baseball team, he refuses right away, saying he`s not in the mood. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 睦子の憂うつ
Mutsuko`s Melancholy
Mutsuko no Yuuutsu
episode.summary: In part thanks to Hikaru and Daigo`s battery, the Mifune Dolphins win their first match of the summer tournament. Head coach Tashiro can`t hold back his tears after finally achieving the victory of his dreams. However, Andy`s injury from the match puts him out for 10 days, which makes the team uneasy when thinking about the 2nd match next week. Amidst all of that, Mutsuko, who was only able to watch the team win the first match from the bench, couldn`t fully banish the unpleasant feelings when she thought about how Daigo and Hikaru got to help the team on the field. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 全力勝負
All-Out Battle
Zenryoku Shoubu
episode.summary: Faced with the slow pitches of the Beatles` Tamaki that throw off their timing, the Dolphins continue to bat poorly. Andy is swapped in to replace Daigo as pitcher, and while this gets the defense back on track, the match nears the final inning. However, when preventing any additional points is so crucial, right fielder Mutsuko falls for a trick of the opponent and allows them to score! The Dolphins have to overcome a 3 point lead, and in the 6th inning, first to go to bat is their number 9, Mutsuko... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 攻略の手がかり
The Key to Success
Kouryaku no Tegakari
episode.summary: Bunts, stealing bases, and other tricks define the Nijigaoka Beatles` playstyle, also known as small ball. The Dolphins lose 2 points from the get go as their opponents exploit the weak bond between Urabe and Daigo, as it`s their first time being a battery. On top of that, the Beatles` ace player Tamaki throws ultra slow balls, which make hits hard, but even when a hit is made, their defense easily takes care of that. Daigo puts his brain into overdrive trying to somehow figure out some pattern in their defense lineup, but will he find anything? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: キャッチャーの経験値
The Experience Level of the Catcher
Catcher no Keikenchi
episode.summary: The Mifune Dolphin`s opponent for the 2nd match of the summer tournament will be the Nijigaoka Beatles. The Beatles` ace player Tamaki is exceptionally tall for a grade schooler and brings his arcing slow ball to the fight. As he had gone to observe them before, Urabe could warn the team of the odd style pitches. On top of that, the Beatles` coach Komori had once been a solid enough player to be battery with Daigo`s dad, Gorou, and he even used to coach the Dolphins before... Now Daigo has to face a team full of tricks and surprises! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 負けたくない
I Don`t Want to Lose
Maketakunai
episode.summary: The Mifune Dolphins best their tough opponent of the 2nd match in the summer tournament, the Beatles, thanks to Hikaru`s outstanding homerun with fully-loaded bases. However, with barely time to rest in the lunch break, match 3 against the Sharks is upon them. Since Urabe was on the mound in the 2nd match, he`s barred by regulations to continue, so Hikaru is the pitcher. Also Mutsuko, despite her extraordinary batting sense, is also on the bench to let the old regular Nagai get some playtime. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 東斗戦プレーボール!
The Touto Match: Play Ball!
Toutosen Play Ball!
episode.summary: In the quarter finals of the summer tournament, the Mifune Dolphins face the powerhouse Touto Boys, with Hikaru and Daigo as their battery. On the other hand, the Touto Boys are already planning for the semi-finals and decided to preserve Mayumura Michiru`s left arm, and send their 2nd pitcher Komatsu on the mound. After not seeing Michiru start, Urabe gets angry, thinking they`re being completely underestimated. However, despite being the 2nd pitcher, Komatsu throws intensely fast balls, impressing on Daigo and Tashiro how much talent and how rich a roster Touto has. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決戦を前に
Before the Big Game
Kessen o Mae ni
episode.summary: Urabe, the Dolphins` ace, was trained by his baseball loving father and triumphantly went on to join the big name team of Touto Boys. In the beginning, Urabe had dreams of making his mark as a pitcher, but in 4th grade, he was denied his chance because Mayumura Wataru, the son of a Major Leaguer, joined mid-seasoned, and given a fast pass to the front of the line. That`s the reason him and his friend Andy to left the Touto Boys. Right when he`s fired up and about to fulfill his dream of getting his revenge on the Touto Boys, Urabe gets a call from head coach Tashiro... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 眉村姉弟
The Mayumura Siblings
Mayumura Kyoudai
episode.summary: Thanks to Hikaru`s shut-out, the Dolphins advance to the quarter finals. Their next opponent is going to be the famous team, Touto Boys, where Urabe and Andy once played. This powerhouse of a team`s main pillars are the left-handed ace Mayumura Michiru and her twin brother Wataru as the catcher. The Mayumura siblings` fahter Mayumura Ken is a famous pitcher who once fought against Daigo`s dad Gorou in the World Series. The Dolphins are visibly shaken by Michiru`s and Wataru`s oppressive presence. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 大吾と光
Daigo and Hikaru
Daigo to Hikaru
episode.summary: The Dolphins start with Hikaru on the mound. Despite losing a point and running into the unexpected trouble of breaking his glasses, he recovers. In the top of the 3rd inning, Daigo`s sacrifice squeeze play nets them a point, showing teeth to the Touto Boys, a team capable of going national. However, in the bottom of the 3rd inning, just when they had tied, Mayumura Michiru hits Hikaru`s fast ball and gets out on base. Hikaru tries his best to control his aim better, but Touto`s offensive lineup is not one to be overcome with little tricks... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: うそだ...!
No Way...!
Uso Da!
episode.summary: During the quarter finals of the summer tournament, where the Dolphins face off against the powerhouse, Touto boys, Nagai`s run on an uncaught third strike brings the team back from the brink of death. Then, in the bottom of the 7th inning, Urabe is under pressure by Touto, with 2 outs and loaded bases, so Hikaru gets up on the mound again. Back in form, Hikaru throws incredibly fast balls, but while trying to catch an easy fly ball, he collides with Daigo and the game is irrevocably lost. The week after the match, worried about Hikaru`s condition, Daigo heads to Gunma... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 運命の一打
The Hit of Destiny
Unmei no Ichida
episode.summary: Inui, head coach for the Touto Boys, had remained completely silent until now, viewing the Dolphins as 2nd rate. However, having them catch up, he finally stirs. He commands their number 4 batter, Mayumura Wataru, to sacrifice himself, and with a squeeze play, they rapidly add two points to their score and pull away from the Dolphins. On top of that, Touto`s ace, Mayumura Michiru, despite not being warmed up, racks up strike-out after strike-out, and the game is in the final inning. But for the Dolphins, too, Daigo and Urabe make it out on base, then with one out and loaded bases, their number 4, Hikaru, is up to bat... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: エース登板
Ace on the Mound
Ace Touban
episode.summary: Being outmatched by the powerful Touto offense lineup, Hikaru steps off the mound and Urabe steps up as the relief pitcher for the Dolphins. Thanks to Urabe`s clean pitching and the recovered Hikaru`s exciting homerun, they give chase, putting up an intense fight to get back into the game. And then, in the top of the 5th inning, the Dolphins` batters get a handle on Touto`s tired starting pitcher, Komatsu. Once again, it`s anyone`s game! Nobody had expected the Dolphins to be a real opponent, but finally, Touto`s ace, Mayumura Michiru, heads to the mound. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 約束
The Promise
Yakusoku
episode.summary: I`m sorry Daigo-kun... I`m sorry for never telling you that I`d recovered this far already! To be honest, I wanted to keep it all secret until I was able to show you all that I`d fully recovered. Hey Daigo-kun! I wrote it in the letter too, right? That we`d form the ultimate battery some day? I can`t run yet, but in middle school, I`m going to join the baseball team. I promise I`ll get back up! So... Daigo-kun, you have to promise that you will never give up the baseball you love so much! Source: crunchyroll
